passages.text: USA | Cosmetics, Household & Personal Care
Buzworthy Beauty Insights Vol 144: ULTA Board Update & 1H Beauty Brand Results

In this edition of our Buzworthy Beauty Industry Insights, we highlight Ulta's new board members, 1H 2025 beauty retail brand results, ELF key catalysts ahead, OLPX M&A, and this week's beauty earnings.

Former Sephora CEO Joins ULTA Board: ULTA appointed Martin Brok and Stephenie Landry to its board this week, effective September 1. Both will serve on the audit and comp committees, bringing extensive experience in global retail and digital operations. Brok, currently CEO of MB Capital Advisors and operating partner at Advent International, was a former Sephora CEO and also held senior roles at Starbucks and Nike. Landry, formerly COO at Honor Technology, held multiple leadership positions at Amazon. Notably, Brok played a key role in Sephora's European expansion, including acquisitions in the U.K. and Germany, which should offer valuable insights as Ulta expands internationally under its Ulta Beauty Unleashed strategy.

1H25 Beauty Retail Brand Results: In 1H 2025, brand sales leaders at Ulta and Sephora included Sol de Janeiro, with notably stronger growth at Ulta. Kerastase and La Roche- Posay also posted significant gains, while private label brands remained popular despite Y/Y declines. Sephora Collection held the top spot at Sephora, followed by Sol de Janeiro and The Ordinary. Clinique and La Roche- Posay were the #1 and #2 brands at Ulta, respectively, while Ulta Beauty Collection ranked #3. Consumer spending patterns varied, with Sephora's peak \(\sim\) \(40 and Ulta's avging\) 30 across a broader price range.

ELF Key Catalysts Update: With Rhode launching in Sephora, we revisit key catalysts ahead for ELF. Early checks show 3ft wall and 6ft aisle displays for Rhode in Sephora stores. Next, we believe ELF is poised to gain share within core US biz, as COTY pulls back investment from CoverGirl which should accelerate share loss. Scanner comps ease in 2H25, supporting a potential reacel. Trade- down trends in Europe should further support ELF's value positioning and growth in int'l markets. See note HERE.

OLPX Biotech Acquisition: OLPX today announced it has acquired biotech firm Purvala Bioscience. Olaplex purchased all shares of the co for \(10.5M\). This is OLPX's first acquisition and should provide them with proprietary molecules to underpin new product innovation. Notably, Purvala has beauty technology within both skincare and hair care, suggesting the acquisition could allow OLPX an avenue into the skin category. See note HERE.

ULTA Earnings Recap: Q2 results were well ahead of expectations. Macro and tougher comps in 2H limited F guide increases, but were still above Street ests. FY comps expected in the \(2.5\%\) to \(+3.5\%\) range (+2.1% cons). EPS raised above ests, and OM% increased and in line w/ cons. Co gained share in mass and prestige, and sales growth seems to have steadied, but OM% levg limited by onfing investments. See note HERE.

BWI Earnings Recap: Q2 sales and EPS were within range of cons. Sales were \(+1.5\%\) Y/Y and at the high end of guide, led by a strong semi- annual sale. FY guide was narrowed, while Q3 EPS was below cons. Tariff impacts will hit hardest in Q3, but mgmt is confident it can improve mitigation offsets over time. Co intends to ramp up digital upgrades and packaging/labeling in the fall, with new customer acquisition a key oppty. Inital take HERE, model update HERE.
Jefferies Weekly Beauty Reports Beauty Secrets: Buzworthy Beauty Industry Insights - Vol. 141

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - Investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies Methodology for assigig ratings may indde the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on sral methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
